INTERSHOP IOM 4.2.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision db15f25148fd9f8d67440a038bc6d1a9014ab333)

Table oms.Shop2PaymentDefDO

Payment methods supported by the shop and some shop specific configurations. By payment lookup, e.g. using the payment method name in an order, there may be a fallback on the paymentName in PaymentDefDO, but only when the shop is mapped to the especial NO_PAYMENT method.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id bigint PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
active boolean Whether the payment method should be used. 
OrderStatesDefDO initOrderStateDefRef integer The initial order state for the payment type that should be used. 
PaymentDefDO paymentDefRef integer  
shopPaymentName varchar(50) The name of payment method as used by the shop in the order service instead of defaults. Example "invoice" 
ShopDO shopRef bigint  
safePayment boolean NOT_NULL false Whether the payment method is secure. 
Payment2ProcessStageDefDO payment2ProcessStageDefRef smallint The process step of the order an invoice or payment can be done, e.g., after submitting an order from the shop. Example 20 
useAutomaticAuthorizationExtension boolean Whether the authorization is automatically extended before expiration. Note that the authorization is limited to max. "authozationDurationInDays". 
authizationDurationInDays integer Duration of persisted payment authorization for the payment method in days.
If NULL or <= 0, the authorization will never expire.
Else ( >0 ), an automatic authorization extension or automatic capture will be triggered, 8 hours before expire date.
Example 30 
timeForPaymentAllowed bigint The period of payment in days. Example 14 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.
